name: There is no Planet B
description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

key_work.title: School Strike for Climate
key_work.brief_description:
On 20 September 2019, more than 300,000 people joined student protestors for the second School Strike for Climate rally to demand urgent political action on the climate crisis.

Thanks to social media, the movement is spreading throughout Australia, helping incite action and effect change.

links.description: An Inconvenient Truth (2006) documented Al Gore’s campaign to educate people about global warming, presenting a lecture featuring alarming statistics, scientific evidence and footage of environmental degradation.

start.title: Happy Feet
start.creator_credit: George Miller, Warren Coleman, Bill Miller, Doug Mitchell, Animal Logic and Kennedy Miller Productions
start.brief_description: Into the world of the Emperor Penguins, who find their soul mates through song, a penguin is born who cannot sing. But he can tap dance something fierce!

end.title: The Day After Tomorrow
end.creator_credit: Roland Emmerich, Ren√©e April, Mark Gordon, 20th Century Fox, Centropolis Entertainment, Lions Gate Films, Mel's Cite du Cinema, The Mark Gordon Company, Barry Chusid, Jeffrey Nachmanoff, Diane Macke, Kristen Branan and Michael Leung

video_links.name: The Day After Tomorrow | #TBT Trailer | 20th Century FOX

end.brief_description: After years of increases in the greenhouse effect, havoc is wreaked globally in the form of catastrophic hurricanes, tornadoes, tidal waves, floods and the beginning of a new Ice Age. Paleoclimatologist, Jack Hall tries to warn the world while also shepherding to safety his son, trapped in New York after the city is overwhelmed by the start of the new big freeze.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

links.description: The genre cli-fi (climate change fiction) explores the impact of environmental destruction, and has been seen in disaster films such as The Day After Tomorrow, in which catastrophic weather events lead to a new ice age.

start.brief_description: There is nowhere more powerful and unforgiving yet more beautiful and compelling than the ocean. Join us and explore the greatest yet least known parts of our planet.

links.description: Blue Planet II, presented by veteran nature documentarian David Attenborough, highlighted the preponderance of plastic in the oceans. The series has been credited with raising awareness of plastic pollution and influencing environmental policy, through the impact known as the “Blue Planet effect”.

end.title: FernGully: The Last Rainforest
end.creator_credit: Bill Kroyer, Diana Young, Peter Faiman, Wayne Young, 20th Century Fox, FAI Films, Kroyer Films, Youngheart Productions and Jim Cox
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1992
end.brief_description: When a sprite named Crysta shrinks a human boy, Zak, down to her size, he vows to help the magical fairy folk stop a greedy logging company from destroying their home: the pristine rainforest known as FernGully. Zak and his new friends fight to defend FernGully from lumberjacks ‚Äî and the vengeful spirit they accidentally unleash after chopping down a magic tree.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: Before Happy Feet, children‚Äôs film FernGully portrayed the effects of deforestation, as the magical inhabitants of an Australian rainforest fight loggers and a pollutant force called Hexxus to save their home.

end.title: Snowpiercer
end.creator_credit: Bong Joon Ho, Catherine George, Benjamin Legrand, Jacques Lob, Jean-Marc Rochette, Jeong Tae-sung, Jeong Won-jo, Miky Lee, Steven Nam, CJ Entertainment, Moho Film, Opus Pictures, SnowPiercer, Stillking Films, TMS Comics, TMS Entertainment, Union Investment Partners, Ondrej Nekvasil, Kelly Masterson and Baik
end.headline_credit: Czech Republic, South Korea and United States of America, 2013
end.brief_description: In a future where a failed global-warming experiment kills off most life on the planet, a class system evolves aboard the Snowpiercer, a train that travels around the globe via a perpetual-motion engine.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B

constellations_other.name: Make it cute, make them think
constellations_other.description: Cartoons and anime are known for their dynamic and vibrant visuals, but beneath the cuteness they can also deliver powerful environmental messages and address the climate crisis.

links.description: Directed by Bong Joon-ho, Snowpiercer imagines a world in which attempts to rectify global warming through geo-engineering have resulted in the Earth being covered in ice, and a group of humans survive on a train endlessly encircling the globe.

Interstellar - Trailer - Official Warner Bros. UK

end.brief_description: The adventures of a group of explorers who make use of a newly discovered wormhole to surpass the limitations on human space travel and conquer the vast distances involved in an interstellar voyage.

constellations_other.name: Future You
constellations_other.description: There are 47,000 possible variations of robot in Future You. There's probably not that many in all of screen culture, but these ones stand out.

constellations_other.name: A brief history of black holes on-screen
constellations_other.description: In 1916, Albert Einstein predicted black holes through his theory of general relativity. That mix of science and imagination can be seen in Marshmallow Laser Feast‚Äôs Distortions in Spacetime. These other works are fascinated by these cosmic giants and represent an evolution in computer graphics and VFX.

links.description: Interstellar‚Äôs journey into space and through time is predicated on the Earth‚Äôs slow decline, and the search for an inhabitable planet to save humankind.

end.title: Natural history diorama
end.credit_line: Philip De Mulder, Colin Harman, Andre Bremer and Edie Kurzer, Australia, 2020
end.brief_description: Growing up, Edie Kurzer’s perceptions of Australia were shaped by the nature documentaries she consumed: whether that was bushman Harry Butler or the work of the Leyland brothers. An ode to the Australian bush, this natural history diorama features some of the format’s most recognisable personalities like Steve and Bindi Irwin and David Attenborough. Taxidermy cane toads sourced from a private collection in South Australia hark back to one of the country’s most popular documentaries, Cane Toads: An Unnatural History (1988), which captivated theatrical audiences in the late 80s. And of course, who could forget Skippy?

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B

links.description: Conservation legend David Attenborough features in Edie Kurzer’s ode to the Australian bush in the natural history diorama in the Federation Square foyer.
